channel.title: SMF navigation bar - help
channel.description:
I'm trying to edit the text on the navigation bar provided by SMF e.g. change the "profile" tab text into "your profile" (i'm not really doing that, just an example). I'm using 2.0.4 (latest version:current time).
I don't mind downloading a mod to do this either.

item.title: SMF navigation bar - help
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

In this case it’s fine because for a moment there I must’ve thought this was for a mod or something.

But yea, all you do is just change the title index for each navigation bar element.

Read full topic

item.title: SMF navigation bar - help
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:17, topic:523205”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=641757.msg4323967#msg4323967 date=1372594601]

Why aren’t you just editing it in Subs instead of going through all this bother for a measly button? It’s a hundred times less painful.

The default buttons use the translation system, so you have to dig into the language files to edit the text. Still a simple ctrl+f, but its not in Subs

Yes, but you can edit that from Subs. Just change the title from $txt[‘something’] to ‘something’ unless the forum is using more than one language.
[/quote]
Which is exactly what I’ve been saying this entire time[/quote]
So that doesn’t answer the question of why the OP isn’t doing it the easy way which was what I originally asked lol…

Read full topic

item.title: SMF navigation bar - help
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:15, topic:523205”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=641757.msg4323959#msg4323959 date=1372593435]
Why aren’t you just editing it in Subs instead of going through all this bother for a measly button? It’s a hundred times less painful.
[/quote]
The default buttons use the translation system, so you have to dig into the language files to edit the text. Still a simple ctrl+f, but its not in Subs[/quote]
Yes, but you can edit that from Subs. Just change the title from $txt[‘something’] to ‘something’ unless the forum is using more than one language.

Read full topic

item.title: SMF navigation bar - help
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

Make sure you’re in Themes/default. A fresh SMF install gives you Themes/default/languages/index.english.php with contents of http://pastebin.com/npRYicTP

Read full topic

item.title: SMF navigation bar - help
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

language php file (only 1 there)

(this is loved up there are only 6 lines to it and mopar’s double quoteing it

<?php $txt['theme_1'] = 'Board'; $txt['theme_2'] = 'Topics'; $txt['theme_3'] = 'Posts'; $txt['theme_4'] = 'Last Post'; $txt['theme_5'] = 'Welcome to'; ?>

If I try to add anything

languages/ThemeStrings.english.php template or language file. Please check the syntax and try again - remember, single quotes (') often have to be escaped with a slash (\). To see more specific error information from PHP, try accessing the file directly.

?

Read full topic

item.title: SMF navigation bar - help
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“Arcik, post:9, topic:523205”][quote author=RevengePK link=topic=641757.msg4323797#msg4323797 date=1372563734]
Subs.PHP
[/quote]

pretty much what hcojustin said.

I won’t be able to actually edit it though subs so I just removed the tab lmao and made a new 1 >.<[/quote]
You can edit it in Subs, it just requires you hardcode 1 language. To stay in the spirit of SMF, go directly to the file with the translations, usually in Themes/default/languages/index..php and change it there, or it can be edited through the Admin CP afaik.

http://www.simplemachines.org/community/index.php?P=bac4da29d98663656207282711e2e668&topic=261880.0

[b]Adding buttons in a multiple language forum[/b]

When adding a button I suggested that you replace $txt[‘home’] with the name that you wanted for your button. This works well until you have a forum with more than one language. Then you’ll need to use the language files so that the text can be translated.

Instead of doing this:

You’ll need to do something like:

Make sure you use a fairly unique name as this will ensure it isn’t the same as some text that SMF is already using. Then you’ll need to open each index.language.php file in Themes / default / languages (obviously replace language with the name of your language). At the bottom of the file add:

Make sure you do the same in every language’s file.

Read full topic

item.title: SMF navigation bar - help
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:


If it is a reference to the txt array, that means it will get the translation for the user's current language. If you want to hardcode English you can, or find the language file and add it in there

If it is a reference to the txt array, that means it will get the translation for the user’s current language. If you want to hardcode English you can, or find the language file and add it in there

Read full topic

item.title: SMF navigation bar - help
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:5, topic:523205”]If you just want to change the text, you can do it quickly inside the language translations, if you want to add new buttons you’ll want to look in Sources/Subs.php and mimic how the other menu items are generated.
http://wiki.simplemachines.org/smf/Buttons_-_How_do_I_add_buttons_to_SMF_2.0[/quote]

I know how to add buttons, pages etc but I can’t change the actual text of the default tabs! Subs.php can be used to change the redirect for the tab but not text :(?

Read full topic

item.title: SMF navigation bar - help
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

If you just want to change the text, you can do it quickly inside the language translations, if you want to add new buttons you’ll want to look in Sources/Subs.php and mimic how the other menu items are generated.
http://wiki.simplemachines.org/smf/Buttons_-_How_do_I_add_buttons_to_SMF_2.0

Read full topic
